occi:kind.title: Datastores are logical containers, analogous to file systems, that hide specifics of each storage device and provide a uniform model for storing virtual machine files. Datastores can also be used for storing ISO images, virtual machine templates, and floppy images.

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: Name of the datastore, if changed and occiUpdate call, rename datastore must be called.

occi:kind.title: Represents a cluster of HostSystem objects as a unified compute resource for virtual machines.

occi:action.title: Add all hostsystem linked to this cluster and not already added on this cluster, if hostsystem are not connectable, the host will not be added

occi:kind.title: The interface to the common container object for hosts and virtual machines. Every host and virtual machine must be under a distinct datacenter in the inventory, and datacenters may not be nested under other datacenters.

occi:attribute.name: defaultHardwareVersionKey
occi:attribute.title: Key for Default Hardware Version to be used on this datacenter in the format of key. Setting this field affects defaultConfigOption returned by environmentBrowser of all its children with this field unset. See ReconfigureDatacenter_Task

occi:action.title: This action create or synchronize all the infrastructure elements detected on VMware in Cloud designer diagram, but does nothing on VMware. This make take some times to synchronize if there is a lot of elements

occi:attribute.name: clusterSupported
occi:attribute.title: Whether or not the host supports clustering capabilities such as HA or DRS and therefore can be added to a cluster. If false, the host must be added as a standalone host. See HostConnectInfo

occi:attribute.name: inDasCluster
occi:attribute.title: If the host is already being managed by a vCenter Server, this property reports true if the host is also part of a vSphere HA enabled cluster. If this is the case, remove or disconnect the host from this cluster before adding it to another vCenter Server.

occi:attribute.name: vimAccountNameRequired
occi:attribute.title: Whether or not the host requires a vimAccountName and password to be set in the ConnectSpec. This is normally only required for VMware Server hosts.

occi:attribute.name: port
occi:attribute.title: The port number.

occi:attribute.name: faultToleranceEnabled

occi:attribute.name: vmotionEnabled

occi:attribute.name: currentEVCModeKey
occi:attribute.title: The Enhanced VMotion Compatibility mode that is currently in effect for this host. If the host is in a cluster where EVC is active, this will match the cluster's EVC mode; otherwise this will be unset.

occi:attribute.name: customValues
occi:attribute.title: The customized field values.

occi:attribute.name: managementServerip
occi:attribute.title: IP address of the VirtualCenter server managing this host, if any.

occi:attribute.name: maxEVCKey
occi:attribute.title: The most capable Enhanced VMotion Compatibility mode supported by the host hardware and software; unset if this host cannot participate in any EVC mode. See supportedEVCMode

occi:attribute.name: distributedCPUFairness
occi:attribute.title: The fairness of distributed CPU resource allocation on the host.

occi:attribute.name: distributedMemoryFairness
occi:attribute.title: The fairness of distributed memory resource allocation on the host.

occi:attribute.name: overallCPUUsage
occi:attribute.title: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in MHz. This is only available if the host is connected.

occi:attribute.name: overallMemoryUsage
occi:attribute.title: Physical memory usage on the host in MB. This is only available if the host is connected.

occi:attribute.name: rebootRequired
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not the host requires a reboot due to a configuration change.

occi:attribute.name: bootTime
occi:attribute.title: The time when the host was booted.

occi:attribute.name: connectionState
occi:attribute.title: The host connection state. See the decription in the enums for the ConnectionState data object type.

occi:attribute.name: inMaintenanceMode
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not the host is in maintenance mode. This flag is set when the host has entered the maintenance mode. It is not set during the entering phase of maintenance mode. See EnterMaintenanceMode_Task See ExitMaintenanceMode_Task

occi:action.title: Disconnects from a host and instructs the server to stop sending heartbeats.

Modifies the permissions on the host, so that it will only be accessible through local console or an authorized centralized management application. Any user defined permissions found on the host are lost.Access via a VI client connected to the host is blocked. Access though other services running on the host is also blocked.If the operation is successful, adminDisabled will be set to true. This API is not supported on the host, If invoked directly on a host, a NotSupported fault will be thrown.

Puts the host in maintenance mode. While this task is running and when the host is in maintenance mode, no virtual machines can be powered on and no provisioning operations can be performed on the host. Once the call completes, it is safe to turn off a host without disrupting any virtual machines

Restores Administrator permission for the local administrative account for the host that was removed by prior call to EnterLockdownMode. If the operation is successful, adminDisabled will be set to false. This API is not supported on the host. If invoked directly on a host, a NotSupported fault will be thrown.
Takes the host out of maintenance mode. This blocks if any concurrent running maintenance-only host configurations operations are being performed. For example, if VMFS volumes are being upgraded.

reconfigures the host for the VMware High Availability (HA) cluster. If the host is part of an HA cluster, this operation reconfigures the host for HA. For example, this operation may be used if a host is added to an HA-enabled cluster and the automatic HA configuration system task fails. Automatic HA configuration may fail for a variety of rea- sons. For example, the host may be configured incorrectly
reconnects to a host. This method is supported only in VirtualCenter

occi:kind.title: Virtual machine compute on a host system

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: Display name of the virtual machine. Any % (percent) character used in this name parameter must be escaped, unless it is used to start an escape sequence. Clients may also escape any other characters in this name parameter. Snapshots of virtual machines that have spaces in their names and are associated with ESX 2.x servers are not supported. Therefore, if you want the option to take snapshots of this virtual machine and you are associating it with an ESX 2.x server, do not use spaces in the name. Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Rename

occi:attribute.name: instanceUUID
occi:attribute.title: VirtualCenter-specific 128-bit UUID of a virtual machine, represented as a hexademical string. This identifier is used by VirtualCenter to uniquely identify all virtual machine instances, including those that may share the same SMBIOS UUID.

occi:attribute.name: template
occi:attribute.title: If true, this virtual machine is set as a template machine and may be used as an image

occi:attribute.name: vcpus
occi:attribute.title: Number of virtual cpus Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.CpuCount

occi:attribute.name: coresPerSocket
occi:attribute.title: Number of cores per socket

occi:attribute.name: guestState

occi:attribute.name: vmwareToolsRunning
occi:attribute.title: is vmware tools running on this virtual machine

occi:attribute.name: guestFullName
occi:attribute.title: This is the full name of the guest operating system for the virtual machine. For example: Windows 2000 Professional.

occi:attribute.name: cpuhotAddEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Whether virtual processors can be added while this virtual machine is running. Since vSphere API 4.0

occi:attribute.name: cpuHotRemoveEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Whether virtual processors can be removed while this virtual machine is running. Since vSphere API 4.0

occi:attribute.name: annotation
occi:attribute.title: User-provided description of the virtual machine. Because this property is optional in the virtual machine configuration, it is necessary to pass an explicit empty string in a ConfigSpec object to remove an annotation that is already present in the VirtualMachineConfigInfo for a virtual machine. Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Rename

Mount vmware tools iso

Register this virtual machine on vcenter

128-bit hash based on the virtual machine's configuration file location and the UUID of the host assigned to run the virtual machine.Normally, this property is not set by a client, allowing the Virtual Infrastructure environment to assign a location ID when the virtual machine is created. However, if the virtual machine's configuration file has been manually moved, it may be desirable to clear this property, setting it to an empty string, so the property is regenerated.Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Settings

occi:kind.title: a link hierarchy folder between datacenter and cluster or between datacenter and virtual machines (vmFolder) or between datacenter and hostsystems

a link between cluster (or host) and virtual machine with resource pool definition, this link may link other resource pools between them to define child dependencies, it may be used too for resourcepoolquickstats informations
Link between cluster and hostsystem
A resource pool linked between a compute host (or a cluster) and a virtual machine, usage attributes part are for runtime information only

occi:attribute.name: expandablereservation
occi:attribute.title: In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value, if the parent resource pool has unreserved resources. A non-expandable reservation is called a fixed reservation. This property is ignored for virtual machines.

occi:attribute.name: limit
occi:attribute.title: The utilization of a virtual machine/resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources. This is typically used to ensure a consistent performance of virtual machines / resource pools independent of available resources. If set to -1, then there is no fixed limit on resource usage (only bounded by available resources and shares). Units are MB for memory, MHz for CPU.

occi:attribute.name: reservation
occi:attribute.title: Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool. Reserved resources are not wasted if they are not used. If the utilization is less than the reservation, the resources can be utilized by other running virtual machines. Units are MB for memory, MHz for CPU.

occi:attribute.name: state
occi:attribute.title:
unknown: The status is unknown. undercommitted: resource pool is in a good state. inconsistent: One or more nodes in the tree has children whose reservations are greater than the node is configured to support. For example, i) a resource pool with a fixed reservation has a running virtual machine with a reservation that is higher than the reservation on resource pool itself., or ii) the child reservations are greater than the limit. In this state, the DRS algorithm is disabled until the resource pool tree's configuration has been brought back into a consistent state. We also restrict the resources that such invalid nodes request from their parents to the configured reservation/limit, in an attempt to isolate the problem to a small subtree. For the rest of the tree, we determine whether the cluster is undercommitted or overcommitted according to the existing rules and perform admission control accordingly.
Note that since all changes to the resource settings are validated on the VirtualCenter server, the system cannot be brought into this state by simply manipulating a cluster resource pool tree through VirtualCenter. It can only happen if a virtual machine gets powered on directly on a host that is part of a DRS cluster. overcommitted: In this state, the tree is consistent internally, but the root resource pool does not have the capacity at to meet the reservation of its children. We can only go from GREEN -> YELLOW if we lose resources at the root. For example, hosts becomes unavailable or is put into maintenance mode. Note that we will always have enough capacity at the root to run all currently powered on VMs. However, we may not be able to satisfy all resource pool reservations in the tree. In this state, the reservation configured for a resource pool is no longer guaranteed, but the limits are still enforced. This provides additional flexibility for bringing the tree back into a consistent state, without risking bringing the tree into a RED state. In more detail: Resource Pool The root is considered to have unlimited capacity. You can reserve resources without any check except the requirement that the tree remains consistent. This means that nodes whose parents are all configured with expandable reservations and no limit will have unlimited available resources. However, if there is an ancestor with a fixed reservation or an expandable reservation with a limit somewhere, then the node will be limited by the reservation/limit of the ancestor. Virtual Machine Virtual machines are limited by ancestors with a fixed reservation and the capacity at the root. yellow: The entity might have a problem.

occi:kind.title: a link between a hostsystem and a virtual machine
a link between a datacenter and a datastore
A virtual disk

occi:action.title:
Overwrite all blocks of the virtual disk with zeros. All data will be lost. The datacenter parameter may be omitted if a URL is used to name the disk.
Requires Datastore.FileManagement privilege on the datastore where the virtual disk resides.

Shrink a sparse virtual disk. The datacenter parameter may be omitted if a URL is used to name the disk.
The optional parameter copy specifies whether to shrink the disk in copy-shrink mode or in-place mode. In copy-shrink mode, additional space is required, but will result in a shrunk disk that is also defragmented. In-place shrink does not require additional space, but will increase fragmentation. The default behavior is to perform copy-shrink if the parameter is not specified.
Requires Datastore.FileManagement privilege on the datastore where the virtual disk resides.

occi:kind.title: a virtual switch for linking virtual network adapter to a hostsystem network

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: Standard virtual switch name, note that the name must be unique on current host

occi:attribute.name: nbport
occi:attribute.title: The number of ports that this virtual switch is configured to use. Changing this setting does not take effect until the next reboot. The maximum value is 1024, although other constraints, such as memory limits, may establish a lower effective limit

occi:attribute.name: beaconInterval
occi:attribute.title: Determines how often, in seconds, a beacon should be sent. See HostVirtualSwitchBeaconConfig and nicfailurecriteria.checkBeacon, for use with bond bridge

occi:attribute.name: mtu
occi:attribute.title: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of the virtual switch in bytes

occi:attribute.name: changeOperation
occi:attribute.title: This property indicates the change operation to apply on this configuration add: Indicates the addition of a network entity to the configuration. edit: Indicates changes on the network entity. The entity must exist or a NotFound error will be thrown remove: Indicates the removal of a network entity from the configuration

occi:kind.title: A port group aggregates multiple ports under a common configuration and provides a stable anchor point for virtual machines connecting to the labeled networks. It is identified by a label, which must be unique to the current host. The optional VLAN ID restricts port group traffic to a logical Ethernet segment within the network

occi:attribute.name: vlanId
occi:attribute.title: The VLAN ID for ports using this port group. Possible values: A value of 0 specifies that you do not want the port group associated with a VLAN. A value from 1 to 4094 specifies a VLAN ID for the port group. A value of 4095 specifies that the port group should use trunk mode, which allows the guest operating system to manage its own VLAN tags

occi:attribute.name: key
occi:attribute.title: The linkable identifier

occi:kind.title: a network adapter for a virtual machine (virtual nic), describes a virtual network adapter representing an adapter that connects to a virtual switch. A VirtualNic differs from a PhysicalNic in that the latter corresponds to a physical device that is connected to the physical network. The former is a virtual device that is connected to a virtual switch. A VirtualNic accesses the external network through a virtual switch that is bridged through a PhysicalNic to a physical network

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: Device name

occi:attribute.name: key

occi:attribute.name: subnetMask
occi:attribute.title: The subnet mask. Note: When DHCP is not enabled, this property can be set explicitly. When DHCP is enabled, this property reflects the current IP configuration and cannot be set.

occi:attribute.name: port
occi:attribute.title: The port on the port group that the virtual network adapter is using when it is enabled.

occi:attribute.title: like vmxnet etc.

occi:attribute.name: subnetMask

Global data object to determine if the global service instance support or not a feature, see ServiceInstance

occi:attribute.name: multiHostSupported

occi:attribute.name: provisioningSupported

occi:attribute.name: userShellAccessSupported

occi:attribute.title: All supported Enhanced VMotion Compatibility modes.Index for ordering the set of modes that apply to a given CPU vendor. Use this property to compare vendor tier values from two modes. Do not use this property to determine the presence or absence of specific features.

occi:attribute.name: defaultOutgoingBlocked

occi:attribute.title: Flag indicating whether the ruleset is enabled. If the ruleset is enabled, all ports specified in the ruleset are opened by the firewall.

occi:attribute.name: required

occi:attribute.name: service
occi:attribute.title: Managed service (if any) that uses this ruleset. Must be one of the services listed in HostService.

occi:action.title: Blocks the firewall ports belonging to the specified ruleset. If the ruleset has a managed service with a policy of 'auto' and all other rulesets used by the service are blocked, stops the service.
Opens the firewall ports belonging to the specified ruleset. If the ruleset has a managed service with a policy of 'auto' that is not running, starts the service.

occi:attribute.name: activeFtp
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not non-passive mode FTP connections should be allowed

occi:attribute.name: allowAnyOui
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not the NAT Service allows media access control traffic from any Organizational Unique Identifier (OUI)? By default, it does not allow traffic that originated from the host to avoid packet loops.

occi:attribute.name: configPort

occi:attribute.name: natKey

occi:attribute.name: guestIpAddress
occi:attribute.title: The IP address for the guest. Network traffic from the host is forwarded to this IP address

occi:attribute.name: guestPort
occi:attribute.title: The port number for the guest. Network traffic from the host is forwarded to this port.

occi:attribute.name: hostPort
occi:attribute.title: The port number on the host. Network traffic sent to the host on this TCP/UDP port is forwarded to the guest at the specified IP address and port.

occi:attribute.name: vmdkFilePathOnDatastore
occi:attribute.title: Represents the vmdk file path.

occi:mixin.title: Settings that control the boot behavior of the virtual machine.These settings take effect during the next power-on of the virtual machine.Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Settings

occi:attribute.name: bootDelay
occi:attribute.title: Delay in milliseconds before starting the boot sequence. The boot delay specifies a time interval between virtual machine power on or restart and the beginning of the boot sequence

occi:attribute.name: bootDeviceOrder
occi:attribute.title: Boot order. Listed devices are used for booting. After list is exhausted, default BIOS boot device algorithm is used for booting. Note that order of the entries in the list is important: device listed first is used for boot first, if that one fails second entry is used, and so on. Platform may have some internal limit on the number of devices it supports. If bootable device is not reached before platform's limit is hit, boot will fail. At least single entry is supported by all products supporting boot order settings.

occi:attribute.name: bootRetryEnabled
occi:attribute.title: If set to true, a virtual machine that fails to boot will try again after the bootRetryDelay time period has expired. When false, the virtual machine waits indefinitely for you to initiate boot retry.

occi:attribute.name: enterBiosSetup
occi:attribute.title: If set to true, the virtual machine automatically enters BIOS setup the next time it boots. The virtual machine resets this flag to false so that subsequent boots proceed normally.

occi:attribute.name: deviceKeys
occi:attribute.title: device key value for bootdevice, must be set in the same order as the bootdevice array.

occi:attribute.name: networkBootProtocol
occi:attribute.title: Protocol to attempt during PXE network boot or NetBoot. ipv4: PXE (or Apple NetBoot) over IPv4. The default. ipv6: PXE over IPv6. Only meaningful for EFI virtual machines.

occi:attribute.name: affinitySet
occi:attribute.title: List of nodes (processors for CPU, NUMA nodes for memory) that may be used by the virtual machine. If the array is empty when modifying the affinity setting, then any existing affinity is removed.

occi:attribute.name: level
occi:attribute.title: custom: If you specify custom for the level property, when there is resource contention the Server uses the shares value to determine resource allocation. high: For CPU: Shares = 2000 * nmumber of virtual CPUs For Memory: Shares = 20 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes For Disk: Shares = 2000 For Network: Shares = networkResourcePoolHighShareValue low: For CPU: Shares = 500 * number of virtual CPUs For Memory: Shares = 5 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes For Disk: Shares = 500 For Network: Shares = 0.25 * networkResourcePoolHighShareValue normal: For CPU: Shares = 1000 * number of virtual CPUs For Memory: Shares = 10 * virtual machine memory size in megabytes For Disk: Shares = 1000 For Network: Shares = 0.5 * networkResourcePoolHighShareValue

occi:attribute.name: shares
occi:attribute.title: The number of shares allocated. Used to determine resource allocation in case of resource contention. This value is only set if level is set to custom. If level is not set to custom, this value is ignored. Therefore, only shares with custom values can be compared. There is no unit for this value. It is a relative measure based on the settings for other resource pools.

occi:attribute.name: networkResourceManagementSupported
occi:attribute.title: Flag to indicate whether network I/O control is supported on the vSphere Distributed Switch. Network I/O control is supported in vSphere Distributed Switch Version 4.1 or later.

occi:attribute.name: networkResourcePoolHighShareValue
occi:attribute.title: This is the value for high in shares. This implicitly defines the legal range of share values to be between 1 and this. This also defines values for other level types, such as normal being one half of this value and low being one fourth of this value. This feature is supported in vSphere Distributed Switch Version 4.1 or later.

occi:attribute.name: qosSupported
occi:attribute.title: Flag to indicate whether Qos Tag(802.1p priority tag)is supported on the vSphere Distributed Switch. Qos Tag is supported in vSphere Distributed Switch Version 5.0 or later.

occi:attribute.name: userDefinedNetworkResourcePoolsSupported
occi:attribute.title: Flag to indicate whether the switch supports creating user defined resource pools. This feature is supported in vSphere Distributed Switch Version 5.0 or later.

occi:attribute.name: nicTeamingPolicy
occi:attribute.title: The available teaming modes for the vSphere Distributed Switch. The value can be one or more of DistributedVirtualSwitchNicTeamingPolicyMode. failover_explicit: Use explicit failover order loadbalance_ip: Routing based on IP hash loadbalance_loadbased: Routing based by dynamically balancing traffic through the NICs in a team. This is the recommended teaming policy when the network I/O control feature is enabled for the vNetwork Distributed Switch. loadbalance_srcid: Route based on the source of the port ID loadbalance_srcmac: Route based on source MAC hash

occi:attribute.name: vmDirectPathGen2Supported
occi:attribute.title: Flag to indicate whether VMDirectPath Gen 2 is supported on the vSphere Distributed Switch. VMDirectPath Gen 2 is supported in vSphere Distributed Switch Version 4.1 or later.

occi:attribute.name: closeOnPowerOffOrSuspend
occi:attribute.title: Close the console application when the virtual machine is powered off or suspended.

occi:attribute.name: enterFullscreenOnPowerOn
occi:attribute.title: Enter full screen mode when this virtual machine is powered on.

occi:attribute.name: powerOnWhenOpened
occi:attribute.title: Power on the virtual machine when it is opened in the console.

occi:mixin.title: holds the configured defaults for the power operations on a virtual machine. The properties indicated whether to do a "soft" or guest initiated operation, or a "hard" operation.

occi:attribute.name: defaultPowerOffType
occi:attribute.title: Default operation for power off: soft or hard

occi:attribute.name: defaultResetType
occi:attribute.title: Default operation for reset: soft or hard

occi:attribute.name: defaultSuspendType
occi:attribute.title: Default operation for suspend: soft or hard

occi:attribute.name: powerOffType
occi:attribute.title: Describes the default power off type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform power off by using the PowerOff method. soft - Perform power off by using the ShutdownGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultPowerOffType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.

occi:attribute.name: resetType
occi:attribute.title: Describes the default reset type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform reset by using the Reset method. soft - Perform reset by using the RebootGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultResetType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.

occi:attribute.name: standbyAction
occi:attribute.title: Behavior of virtual machine when it receives the S1 ACPI call.

occi:attribute.name: suspendType
occi:attribute.title: Describes the default suspend type for this virtual machine. The possible values are specified by the PowerOpType. hard - Perform suspend by using the Suspend method. soft - Perform suspend by using the StandbyGuest method. preset - The preset value is specified in the defaultSuspendType section. This setting is advisory and clients can choose to ignore it.

occi:attribute.name: disableAcceleration
occi:attribute.title: Flag to turn off video acceleration for a virtual machine console window.

occi:attribute.name: diskUUIDEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether disk UUIDs are being used by this virtual machine. If this flag is set to false, disk UUIDs are not exposed to the guest. Since products before ESX 3.1 do not support disk UUIDs, moving virtual machines from a platform that supports UUID to a platform that does not support UUIDs could result in unspecified guest behavior. For virtual machines where the ability to move to older platforms is important, this flag should be set to false. If the value is unset, the behavior 'false' will be used.

occi:attribute.name: enableLogging
occi:attribute.title: Flag to enable logging for a virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: htSharing
occi:attribute.title: Specifies how the VCPUs of a virtual machine are allowed to share physical cores on a hyperthreaded system. Two VCPUs are "sharing" a core if they are both running on logical CPUs of the core at the same time. See VirtualMachineHtSharing possible values : any : VCPUs may freely share cores at any time with any other VCPUs (default for all virtual machines on a hyperthreaded system). internal : Similar to "none", in that VCPUs from this virtual machine will not be allowed to share cores with VCPUs from other virtual machines. However, other VCPUs from the same virtual machine will be allowed to share cores together. This configuration option is only permitted for SMP virtual machines. If applied to a uniprocessor virtual machine, it will be converted to the "none" sharing option. none : VCPUs should not share cores with each other or with VCPUs from other virtual machines. That is, each VCPU from this virtual machine should always get a whole core to itself, with the other logical CPU on that core being placed into the "halted" state.

occi:attribute.name: monitorType
occi:attribute.title: vmx process type. See VirtualMachineFlagInfoMonitorType for possible values for this property. debug: Run vmx in debug mode release: Run vmx in default mode, matching the build type of vmkernel. stats: Run vmx in stats mode.

occi:attribute.name: recordReplayEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether record and replay operations are allowed for this virtual machine. If this flag is set to 'true', instruction virtualization will use hardware virtualization (HV) support. I.e., virtualExecUsage will be set to 'hvOn'. If this flag is set to 'false' for a virtual machine that already has a recording, replay will be disallowed, though the recording will be preserved. If the value is unset, the behavior 'false' will be used.

occi:attribute.name: snapshotLocked
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether the snapshot tree is locked for this virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: snapshotPowerOffBehavior
occi:attribute.title: Specifies the power-off behavior for a virtual machine that has a snapshot. If the value is unset, the behavior 'powerOff' will be used. powerOff: Just power off the virtual machine prompt: Prompt the user for instruction at power-off time. revert: Revert to the snapshot.

occi:attribute.name: useToe
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not to use TOE (TCP/IP Offloading).

occi:attribute.name: virtualExecUsage
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not the system will try to use Hardware Virtualization (HV) support for instruction virtualization, if available. By default, VMware software will determine whether or not to use hardware virtualization support based on various factors such as the guest operating system type and the physical hardware. Certain workloads can benefit from explicitly turning hardware virtualization support on or off. If the value is unset, the value will default to hvAuto. VirtualMachineFlagInfoVirtualExecUsage represents the set of possible values. New processors can enable two hardware acceleration technologies for virtualization, one for instruction virtualization and the other for MMU virtualization. Intel names its hardware-assisted instruction virtualization as VT, and its hardware-assisted MMU virtualization as EPT. AMD calls them as AMD-V and RVI, respectively. For details on these technologies, please refer to documents from the processor vendors. virtualExecUsage controls instruction virtualization; while virtualMmuUsage controls MMU virtualization. "On" allows hardware acceleration, while "off" only allows software solution. There are four meaningful combinations. (hvAuto, automatic) - The host chooses which feature to use. (hvOn, on) - Use both VT/AMD-V and EPT/RVI. (hvOn, off) - Use VT/AMD-V but do not use EPT/RVI. (hvOff, off) - Do not use any of these hardware acceleration technologies. hvAuto: Determine automatically whether to use hardware virtualization (HV) support. hvOff: Do not use hardware virtualization (HV) support. hvOn: Use hardware virtualization (HV) support if the physical hardware supports it.

occi:attribute.name: virtualMMUUsage
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not the system will try to use nested page table hardware support, if available. By default, VMware software will determine whether or not to use nested page table hardware support based on various factors such as the guest operating system type and the physical hardware. Certain workloads can benefit from explicitly turning nested page table hardware support on or off; this can be set using nptUsage flag. If the value is unset, the value will default to automatic. VirtualMachineFlagInfoVirtualMmuUsage represents the set of possible values. automatic: Determine automatically whether to use nested page table hardware support. off: Do not use nested page table hardware support. on: Use nested paging hardware support if the physical hardware supports it.

occi:mixin.title: Traffic shaping is used to configure the network utilization characteristics of a virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: averageBPS
occi:attribute.title: Average bandwidth, in bits per second.

occi:attribute.name: burstSize
occi:attribute.title: Burst size, in bytes.

occi:attribute.name: enabled
occi:attribute.title: Is the shaper enabled?

occi:attribute.name: peakBPS
occi:attribute.title: Peak bandwidth, in bits per second.

occi:attribute.name: npivDesiredNodeWwns
occi:attribute.title: The NPIV node WWNs to be extended from the original list of WWN nummbers. This property should be set to desired number which is an aggregate of existing plus new numbers. Desired Node WWNs should always be greater than the existing number of node WWNs

occi:attribute.name: npivDesiredPortWwns
occi:attribute.title: The NPIV port WWNs to be extended from the original list of WWN nummbers. This property should be set to desired number which is an aggregate of existing plus new numbers. Desired Node WWNs should always be greater than the existing number of port WWNs

occi:attribute.name: npivNodeWorldWideName
occi:attribute.title: A 64-bit node WWN (World Wide Name). These WWNs are paired with the npivPortWorldWideName to be used by the NPIV VPORTs instantiated for the virtual machine on the physical HBAs of the host. A pair of node and port WWNs serves as a unique identifier in accessing a LUN, so that it can be monitored or controlled by the storage administrator. If this property contains a single node WWN, the same node WWN is used to pair with all port WWNs listed in npivPortWorldWideName. If this property or npivPortWorldWideName is empty or unset, NPIV WWN is disabled for the virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: npivOnNonRdmDisks
occi:attribute.title: This property is used to check whether the NPIV can be enabled on the Virtual machine with non-rdm disks in the configuration, so this is potentially not enabling npiv on vmfs disks. Also this property is used to check whether RDM is required to generate WWNs for a virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: npivPortWorldWideName
occi:attribute.title: A 64-bit port WWN (World Wide Name). For detail description on WWN, see npivNodeWorldWideName.

occi:attribute.name: npivTemporaryDisabled
occi:attribute.title: This property is used to enable or disable the NPIV capability on a desired virtual machine on a temporary basis. When this property is set NPIV Vport will not be instantiated by the VMX process of the Virtual Machine. When this property is set port WWNs and node WWNs in the VM configuration are preserved.

occi:attribute.name: npivWorldWideNameType
occi:attribute.title: The source that provides/generates the assigned WWNs. external: This set of WWNs is provided by the client. host: This set of WWNs is generated by Host Agent. vc: This set of WWNs is generated by VC server. It is only set by vcenter

occi:attribute.name: npivWorldWideNameOp
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate what type of NPIV WWN operation is going to be performed on the virtual machine. If unset, it indicates no change to existing NPIV WWN assignment (or not assigned) in the virtual machine. Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Settings.

occi:mixin.title: Specifies the CPU feature compatibility masks.Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.Settings

occi:attribute.name: eax
occi:attribute.title: String representing the required EAX bits.

occi:attribute.name: ebx
occi:attribute.title: String representing the required EBX bits.

occi:attribute.name: ecx
occi:attribute.title: String representing the required ECX bits.

occi:attribute.name: edx
occi:attribute.title: String representing the required EDX bits.

occi:attribute.name: level
occi:attribute.title: Level (EAX input to CPUID).

occi:attribute.name: vendor
occi:attribute.title: Used if this mask is for a particular vendor.

occi:mixin.title: Additional configuration information for the virtual machine.This describes a set of modifications to the additional options. An option is removed if the key is present but the value is not set or the value is an empty string. Otherwise, the key is set to the new value.Configuration keys that would conflict with parameters that are explicitly configurable through other fields in the ConfigSpec object are silently ignored.Reconfigure privilege: VirtualMachine.Config.AdvancedConfig (also required when setting this property while creating a virtual machine)

occi:attribute.name: key
occi:attribute.title: The name of the option using dot notation to reflect the option's position in a hierarchy. For example, you might have an option called "Ethernet" and another option that is a child of that called "Connection". In this case, the key for the latter could be defined as "Ethernet.Connection"

occi:attribute.name: value
occi:attribute.title: The value of the option. The Any data object type enables you to define any value for the option. Typically, however, the value of an option is of type String or Integer.

occi:attribute.name: snapshotDirectory
occi:attribute.title: Path name of the directory that holds suspend and snapshot files belonging to the virtual machine. Prior to vSphere 5.0, this directory also holds snapshot redo files. Starting with vSphere 5.0, the redo files will stay in the same directory as the snapshotted disk, thus this directory will no longer hold the snapshot redo files. This path name defaults to the same directory as the configuration file. ESX Server requires this to indicate a VMFS volume or NAS volume (for ESX Server 3). In case the configuration file is not stored on VMFS or NAS, this property must be set explicitly. See VirtualMachineFileInfo

occi:attribute.name: vmPathName
occi:attribute.title: Path name to the configuration file for the virtual machine, e.g., the .vmx file. This also implicitly defines the configuration directory. See VirtualMachineFileInfo

occi:attribute.name: suspendDirectory
occi:attribute.title: Some products allow the suspend directory to be different than the snapshot directory. On products where this is not possible, setting of this property is ignored. See VirtualMachineFileInfo

occi:attribute.name: logDirectory
occi:attribute.title: Directory to store the log files for the virtual machine. If not specified, this defaults to the same directory as the configuration file See VirtualMachineFileInfo

occi:attribute.name: ftMetadataDirectory
occi:attribute.title: Directory to store the fault tolerance meta data files for the virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: alternateGuestName
occi:attribute.title: Used as display name for the operating system if guestId is other or other-64.

occi:attribute.name: smbiosUUID
occi:attribute.title: 128-bit SMBIOS UUID of a virtual machine represented as a hexadecimal string in "12345678-abcd-1234-cdef-123456789abc" format

occi:attribute.name: firmware
occi:attribute.title: Information about firmware type for this Virtual Machine. Possible values are described in GuestOsDescriptorFirmwareType Since vSphere API 5.0

occi:attribute.name: guestAutoLockEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether the guest operating system will logout any active sessions whenever there are no remote display connections open to the virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: afterPowerOn
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run after the virtual machine powers on.

occi:attribute.name: afterResume
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run after the virtual machine resumes.

occi:attribute.name: beforeGuestReboot
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine reboots.

occi:attribute.name: beforeGuestShutdown
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine powers off.

occi:attribute.name: beforeGuestStandby
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether or not scripts should run before the virtual machine suspends.

occi:attribute.name: pendingCustomization
occi:attribute.title: When set, this indicates that a customization operation is pending on the VM. The value represents the filename of the customization package on the host.

occi:attribute.name: synctimeWithHost
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not the tools program will sync time with the host time

occi:attribute.name: toolsUpgradePolicy
occi:attribute.title: Tools upgrade policy setting for the virtual machine. manual: No auto-upgrades for tools will be performed for this virtual machine. Users must manually invoke the UpgradeTools operation to update the tools. upgradeAtPowerCycle: When the virtual machine is power-cycled, the system checks for a newer version of tools when the VM comes back up. If it is available, a tools upgrade is automatically performed on the virtual machine and it is rebooted if necessary.

occi:attribute.name: toolsVersion
occi:attribute.title: Version of VMware Tools installed on the guest operating system.

occi:attribute.name: name
occi:attribute.title: The name of the host providing the service for which the ticket applies. If omitted, then the client uses the host name for the server that issued the ticket.

occi:attribute.name: sessionid
occi:attribute.title: An identifying string for the session created for the ticketed connection. This is used by the host service to identify the operations permitted within the session.

occi:attribute.name: port
occi:attribute.title: Access to some services is made possible by connecting to a port on a server. If the service for which a ticket is issued is available on a particular port, that port number is specified with this property. If omitted, except in the case of connecting to CIM interfaces, the port number for the service that issued the ticket is used. In the case of connecting to a CIM interface the standard well known port for the particular service will be used for the connection.

occi:attribute.name: service
occi:attribute.title: The name of the service to which to connect.

occi:attribute.name: serviceVersion
occi:attribute.title: A dot-separated string identifying the service protocol version. For example, 1.0 is used for NFC hosted by vpxa on ESX 2.5, and 1.1 is used for NFC hosted by hostd on ESX 3.0.

occi:attribute.name: sslThumbPrint
occi:attribute.title: The expected thumbprint of the SSL cert of the host to which we are connecting.

occi:action.title: Creates and returns a one-time credential used to establish a remote connection to a CIM interface. The port to connect to is the standard well known port for the service.

occi:attribute.name: type
occi:attribute.title: Resource allocation type to define (cpu, memory or network)

occi:attribute.name: cpuReservationUsed
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources that have been used to satisfy the reservation requirements of all descendants of this resource pool (includes both resource pools and virtual machines).

occi:attribute.name: cpuUnreservedForVm
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources available to satisfy a reservation for a child virtual machine. In general, this should be the same as unreservedForPool. However, in the overcommitted case, this is limited by the remaining available resources at the root node

occi:attribute.name: memReservationUsed
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources that have been used to satisfy the reservation requirements of all descendants of this resource pool (includes both resource pools and virtual machines).

occi:attribute.name: memUnreservedForVm
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources available to satisfy a reservation for a child virtual machine. In general, this should be the same as unreservedForPool. However, in the overcommitted case, this is limited by the remaining available resources at the root node

occi:attribute.name: memReservationUsedforVm
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources that have been used to satisfy the reservation requirements of running virtual machines in this resource pool or any of its child resource pools.

occi:attribute.name: cpuMaxUsage
occi:attribute.title: Current upper-bound on usage. The upper-bound is based on the limit configured on this resource pool, as well as limits configured on any parent resource pool

occi:attribute.name: memMaxUsage
occi:attribute.title: Current upper-bound on usage. The upper-bound is based on the limit configured on this resource pool, as well as limits configured on any parent resource pool

occi:attribute.name: cpuReservationUsedForVm
occi:attribute.title: Total amount of resources that have been used to satisfy the reservation requirements of running virtual machines in this resource pool or any of its child resource pools.

occi:attribute.name: staticMemoryEntitlement
occi:attribute.title: The static memory resource entitlement for a virtual machine. This value is calculated based on this virtual machine's resource reservations, shares and limit, and doesn't take into account current usage. This is the worst case memory allocation for this virtual machine, that is, the amount of memory this virtual machine would receive if all virtual machines running in the cluster went to maximum consumption. Units are MB.

occi:attribute.name: overallCPUDemand
occi:attribute.title: Basic CPU performance statistics, in MHz.

occi:attribute.name: compressedMemory
occi:attribute.title: The amount of compressed memory currently consumed by VM, in KB.

occi:attribute.name: staticCPUEntitlement
occi:attribute.title: The static CPU resource entitlement for a virtual machine. This value is calculated based on this virtual machine's resource reservations, shares and limit, and doesn't take into account current usage. This is the worst case CPU allocation for this virtual machine, that is, the amount of CPU resource this virtual machine would receive if all virtual machines running in the cluster went to maximum consumption. Units are MHz.

occi:attribute.name: guestMemoryUsage
occi:attribute.title: Guest memory utilization statistics, in MB. This is also known as active guest memory. The number can be between 0 and the configured memory size of a virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: sharedMemory
occi:attribute.title: The portion of memory, in MB, that is granted to a virtual machine from host memory that is shared between VMs.

occi:attribute.name: consumedOverheadMemory
occi:attribute.title: The amount of overhead memory, in MB, currently being consumed to run a VM. This value is limited by the overhead memory reservation for a VM, stored in overheadMemory.

occi:attribute.name: balloonedMemory
occi:attribute.title: The size of the balloon driver in a virtual machine, in MB. The host will inflate the balloon driver to reclaim physical memory from a virtual machine. This is a sign that there is memory pressure on the host.

occi:attribute.name: overallCPUUsage
occi:attribute.title: Basic CPU performance statistics, in MHz.

occi:attribute.name: swappedMemory
occi:attribute.title: The portion of memory, in MB, that is granted to a virtual machine from the host's swap space. This is a sign that there is memory pressure on the host.

occi:attribute.name: configuredMemoryMB
occi:attribute.title: Total configured memory of all virtual machines in the resource pool, in MB See ResourcePoolSummary

occi:attribute.name: overheadMemory
occi:attribute.title: The amount of memory resource (in MB) that will be used by a virtual machine above its guest memory requirements. This value is set if and only if a virtual machine is registered on a host that supports memory resource allocation features. For powered off VMs, this is the minimum overhead required to power on the VM on the registered host. For powered on VMs, this is the current overhead reservation, a value which is almost always larger than the minimum overhead, and which grows with time. See QueryMemoryOverheadEx

occi:attribute.name: privateMemory
occi:attribute.title: The portion of memory, in MB, that is granted to a virtual machine from non-shared host memory.

occi:attribute.name: distributedCPUEntitlement
occi:attribute.title: This is the amount of memory, in MB, that this VM is entitled to, as calculated by DRS. Valid only for a VM managed by DRS

occi:attribute.name: hostMemoryUsage
occi:attribute.title: Host memory utilization statistics, in MB. This is also known as consummed host memory. This is between 0 and the configured resource limit. Valid while a virtual machine is running. This includes the overhead memory of a virtual machine.

occi:attribute.name: otherIdentifierType
occi:attribute.title: Other identification information. This information may be vendor specific.

occi:attribute.name: otherIdentifierValues
occi:attribute.title: Other identification information. This information may be vendor specific.

occi:attribute.name: cpuThreads
occi:attribute.title: Number of physical CPU threads on the host

occi:attribute.name: cpuModel
occi:attribute.title: The CPU model.

occi:attribute.name: cpus
occi:attribute.title: Number of physical CPU packages on the host. Physical CPU packages are chips that contain one or more processors. Processors contained by a package are also known as CPU cores. For example, one dual-core package is comprised of one chip that contains two CPU cores.

occi:attribute.name: vendor
occi:attribute.title: The hardware vendor identification

occi:attribute.name: model
occi:attribute.title: The system model identification.

occi:attribute.name: hbas
occi:attribute.title: The number of host bus adapters (HBAs).

occi:attribute.name: biosUUID
occi:attribute.title: The hardware BIOS identification

occi:attribute.name: biosVersion
occi:attribute.title: The current BIOS version of the physical chassis

occi:attribute.name: biosReleaseDate
occi:attribute.title: The release date for the BIOS

occi:attribute.name: apiType
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not the service instance represents a standalone host. If the service instance represents a standalone host, then the physical inventory for that service instance is fixed to that single host. VirtualCenter server provides additional features over single hosts. For example, VirtualCenter offers multi-host management. Examples of values are: "VirtualCenter" - For a VirtualCenter instance. "HostAgent" - For host agent on an ESX Server or VMware Server host.

occi:attribute.name: apiVersion
occi:attribute.title: The version of the API as a dot-separated string. For example, "1.0.0".

occi:attribute.name: build
occi:attribute.title: Build string for the server on which this call is made. For example, x.y.z-num. This string does not apply to the API.

occi:attribute.name: fullname
occi:attribute.title: The complete product name, including the version information.

occi:attribute.name: localeBuild
occi:attribute.title: Build number for the current session's locale. Typically, this is a small number reflecting a localization change from the normal product build.

occi:attribute.name: localeVersion
occi:attribute.title: Version of the message catalog for the current session's locale.

occi:attribute.name: shortname
occi:attribute.title: Short form of the product name.

occi:attribute.name: osType
occi:attribute.title: Operating system type and architecture. Examples of values are: "win32-x86" - For x86-based Windows systems. "linux-x86" - For x86-based Linux systems. "vmnix-x86" - For the x86 ESX Server microkernel.

occi:attribute.name: productLineId
occi:attribute.title: The product ID is a unique identifier for a product line. Examples of values are: "gsx" - For the VMware Server product or the GSX Server product. "esx" - For the ESX Server product. "vpx" - For the VirtualCenter product.

occi:attribute.name: vendorName
occi:attribute.title: Name of the vendor of this product.

occi:attribute.name: productVersion
occi:attribute.title: Dot-separated version string. For example, "1.2".

occi:attribute.name: adminDisabled
occi:attribute.title: If the flag is true, the permission on the host has been modified such that only the user account used for VirtualCenter operation have Administrator permission. This flag is result of the operations of DisableAdmin and EnableAdmin. This flag is supported in VirtualCenter only. The value returned from host should be ignored. See DisableAdmin See EnableAdmin

occi:attribute.name: datastorePrincipal
occi:attribute.title: Datastore principal user

occi:attribute.name: localeSwapDatastoreName
occi:attribute.title: Datastore visible to this host that may be used to store virtual machine swapfiles, for virtual machines executing on this host. The value of this property is set or unset by invoking UpdateLocalSwapDatastore. The policy for using this datastore is determined by the compute resource configuration's vmSwapPlacement property in concert with each individual virtual machine configuration's swapPlacement property. Note: Using a host-specific swap location may degrade VMotion performance.

occi:attribute.name: diagnosticType
occi:attribute.title: Indicates the type of the diagnostic partition

occi:attribute.name: diskNameVMFS
occi:attribute.title: The SCSI disk device on which a VMware File System (VMFS) extent resides. See HostScsiDisk See canonicalName

occi:attribute.name: partition
occi:attribute.title: The partition number of the partition on the ScsiDisk.

occi:attribute.name: slots
occi:attribute.title: The number of slots in the diagnostic partition.

occi:attribute.name: storageType
occi:attribute.title: Indicates the storage type of the diagnostic partition.See DiagnosticPartitionStorageType

occi:mixin.title: Defines the system default auto-start/auto-stop values.

occi:attribute.name: autostartManagerEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether or not auto-start manager is enabled.

occi:attribute.name: startDelay
occi:attribute.title: System-default autoStart delay in seconds. The default is 120 seconds.

occi:attribute.name: stopAction
occi:attribute.title: System-default power-off action. Used if the stopAction string in the AutoPowerInfo object for a particular machine is set to systemDefault. If stopAction and startAction for a virtual machine are both set to none, that virtual machine is removed from the AutoStart sequence.

occi:attribute.name: stopDelay
occi:attribute.title: System-default autoStop delay in seconds. The default is 120 seconds.

occi:attribute.name: waitForHeartbeat
occi:attribute.title: System-default waitForHeartbeat setting.

occi:mixin.title: Capability vector indicating the available network product features.

occi:attribute.name: canSetPhysicalNicLinkSpeed
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not a physical network adapter's link speed and duplex settings can be changed through this API. For a hosted product, the host uses its physical network adapters for network connectivity. Configuration of link speed is done through regular host operations. In ESX Server, the configuration can be changed through this API

occi:attribute.name: dhcpOnVnicSupported
occi:attribute.title: This flag indicates whether or not the host is able to support dhcp configuration for vnics.

occi:attribute.name: dnsConfigSupported
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether DNS configuration for the host is supported.

occi:attribute.name: ipRouteConfigSupported
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether ip route configuration for the host is supported.

occi:attribute.name: maxPortGroupsPerVswitch
occi:attribute.title: The maximum number of port groups supported per virtual switch. This property will not be set if this value is unlimited.

occi:attribute.name: nicTeamingPolicy
occi:attribute.title: The available teaming policies if the platform supports network adapter teaming.

occi:attribute.name: supportsNetworkHints
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not the host is able to support the querying of network hints.

occi:attribute.name: supportsNicTeaming
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not network adapter teaming is available. Multiple network adapters can be bridged to a virtual switch through a BondBridge. Also, network adapter teaming policies such as failover order and detection are enabled.

occi:attribute.name: supportsVlan
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not VLANs can be configured on PortGroups attached to VirtualSwitch objects. This allows VLANs for virtual machines without requiring special VLAN capable hardware switches.

occi:attribute.name: usesServiceConsoleNic
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not a service console network adapter is used or required. This means that the system software has two TCP/IP stacks. As a result, at least two types of VirtualNics may be created -- the normal VirtualNic and the service console VirtualNic. If this is not set, then only the VirtualNic type is supported.

occi:attribute.name: vnicConfigSupported
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether vnic configuration is supported. This means that operations to add, remove, update virtualNic are supported.

occi:attribute.name: vswitchConfigSupported
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether virtual switch configuration is supported. This means that operations to add, remove, update virtual switches are supported.

occi:mixin.title: Autostart configuration, these values are found via HostSystem.HostConfigInfo object and autoStart property

occi:attribute.name: stopDelay
occi:attribute.title: Delay in seconds before continuing with the next virtual machine in the order sequence. If the delay is -1, then the hostsystem default is used.

occi:attribute.name: stopAction
occi:attribute.title: Defines the stop action for the virtual machine. Can be set to none, systemDefault, powerOff, or suspend. If set to none, then the virtual machine does not participate in auto-stop.

occi:attribute.name: waitForHeartbeat
occi:attribute.title: System-default waitForHeartbeat setting.

occi:attribute.name: startDelay
occi:attribute.title: Delay in seconds before continuing with the next virtual machine in the order of machines to be started. If the delay is specified as -1, then the system default is used.

occi:attribute.name: startAction
occi:attribute.title: How to start the virtual machine. Valid settings are none or powerOn. If set to none, then the virtual machine does not participate in auto-start.

occi:attribute.name: startOrder
occi:attribute.title:
The autostart priority of this virtual machine. Virtual machines with a lower number are powered on first. On host shutdown, the virtual machines are shut down in reverse order, meaning those with a higher number are powered off first. Positive values indicate a start order and -1 indicates the machine can be powered on at any time. Machines with a -1 value are typically powered on and off after all virtual machines with positive startOrder values. Failure to meet the following requirements results in an InvalidArgument exception:
startOrder must be set to -1 if startAction is set to none startOrder must be -1 or positive integers. Values such as 0 or -2 are not valid. startOrder is relative to other virtual machines in the autostart sequence. Hence specifying a startOrder of 4 when there are only 3 virtual machines in the Autostart sequence is not valid. If a newly established or changed startOrder value for a virtual machine matches an existing startOrder value, the newly applied value takes precedence, and the existing value is incremented by one. The incremented startOrder value is checked for collisions, and the same rule is applied if one is found. This simple system ensures no two virtual machines ever have the same order number.
For example, consider the case where there are three virtual machines with different startOrder values. Virtual machine A has not yet established a startOrder, virtual machine B has a startOrder value of 1 and Virtual Machine C has a startOrder value of 2. If virtual machine A's startOrder is set to 1, then virtual machine B's startOrder is incremented to 2. This creates a conflict with virtual machine C's startOrder value, which is also incremented, this time to 3.

occi:mixin.title: This mixin describes the amount of memory that is being reserved by the service console. Memory reserved for use by the service console is a hard reservation that cannot be changed except across hardware restarts

occi:attribute.name: serviceConsoleReserved
occi:attribute.title: The amount of memory that is currently reserved for the service console.

occi:attribute.name: serviceConsoleReservedCfg
occi:attribute.title: The amount of memory that should be reserved for the service console on the next boot.

occi:attribute.name: unreserved
occi:attribute.title: The amount of memory that is not reserved for use by the service console

occi:attribute.name: allocationPolicy
occi:attribute.title: Policy for allocating additional memory for virtual machines. See AllocationPolicy

occi:attribute.name: virtualMachineMax
occi:attribute.title: The maximum amount of memory reserved for all running virtual machines, in bytes.

occi:attribute.name: virtualMachineMin
occi:attribute.title: The minimum amount of memory reserved for all running virtual machines, in bytes

occi:attribute.name: virtualMachineReserved
occi:attribute.title: The amount of memory reserved for all running virtual machines, in bytes.

occi:action.title: Sets the configured service console memory reservation. This change affects only the serviceConsoleReservedCfg property. The configuration change propagates to the other properties after the next boot.
Updates the virtual machine reservation information.

occi:attribute.name: localDatastoreSupported
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether local datastores are supported.

occi:attribute.name: nfsMountCreationRequired
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether mounting the NFS volume is required to be done as part of NAS datastore creation. If this is set to true, then NAS datastores cannot be created for currently mounted NFS volumes.

occi:attribute.name: nfsMountCreationSupported
occi:attribute.title: Indicates whether mounting an NFS volume is supported when a NAS datastore is created. If this option is false, then NAS datastores corresponding to NFS volumes can be created only for already mounted NFS volumes.

occi:mixin.title: Configuration information for the NTP (Network Time Protocol) service.

occi:attribute.name: hostNTPServers
occi:attribute.title: List of time servers, specified as either IP addresses or fully qualified domain names (FQDNs).

occi:attribute.name: backgroundSnapshotsEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Flag to specify whether background snapshots are enabled.

occi:mixin.title: provides an interface through which you can gather and configure the host CPU scheduler policies that affect the performance of running virtual machines

occi:attribute.name: hyperThreadActive
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not the CPU scheduler is currently treating hyperthreads as schedulable resources. Setting this property involves a successful invocation of either the enableHyperThreading() method (true) or the disableHyperthreading() method (false). The property is set once the system is rebooted.

occi:attribute.name: hyperThreadAvailable
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not hyperthreading optimization is available on the system. This property is set by VMware prior to installation.

occi:attribute.name: hyperThreadConfig
occi:attribute.title: The flag to indicate whether or not the CPU scheduler should treat hyperthreads as schedulable resources the next time the CPU scheduler starts. This property is set to "true" by successfully invoking the enableHyperThreading() method. This property is set to "false" by successfully invoking the disableHyperthreading() method.

occi:mixin.title: Volumes mounted on host

occi:attribute.name: accessible
occi:attribute.title: Flag that indicates if the datastore is currently accessible from the host. For the case of standalone host agent, this property has the same value as Datastore.Summary.accessible and hence the latter can be used equivalently if this one is not set. VirtualCenter Server will always make sure it is set correctly.

occi:attribute.name: accessMode
occi:attribute.title: Access mode to the underlying file system this host has.

occi:attribute.name: hostVolumeType
occi:attribute.title: Type of file system volume.The following values are defined: vmfs: VMware File System (ESX Server only). If this is set, the type of the file system volume is VMFS. nfs: Network file system (Linux only and ESX Server only). If this is set, the type of the file system volume is NetworkFileSystem. cifs: Common Internet file system (Windows only). If this is set, the type of the file system volume is CIFS.

occi:mixin.title: Host Volume filesystem informations

occi:attribute.name: volumeTypeList
occi:attribute.title: The list of supported file system volume types.

occi:attribute.name: pciBus
occi:attribute.title: The bus ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciClassId
occi:attribute.title: The class of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciDeviceId
occi:attribute.title: The device ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciDeviceName
occi:attribute.title: The device name of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciFunction
occi:attribute.title: The function ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciId
occi:attribute.title: The name ID of this PCI, composed of "bus:slot.function"

occi:attribute.name: pciSlot
occi:attribute.title: The slot ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciSubDeviceId
occi:attribute.title: The subdevice ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciSubVendorId
occi:attribute.title: The subvendor ID of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: pciVendorId
occi:attribute.title: The vendor ID of this PCI.

occi:attribute.name: pciVendorName
occi:attribute.title: The vendor name of this PCI

occi:attribute.name: actionType
occi:attribute.title: The action that was executed recently

occi:attribute.name: actionTime
occi:attribute.title: The time when the action was executed.

occi:mixin.title: list of recommended actions for the cluster. It is possible that the current set of recommendations may be empty, either due to not having any running dynamic recommendation generation module, or since there may be no recommended actions at this time
Summary resources informations (aggregate from hosts)

occi:attribute.name: effectiveCpu
occi:attribute.title: Effective CPU resources (in MHz) available to run virtual machines. This is the aggregated effective resource level from all running hosts. Hosts that are in maintenance mode or are unresponsive are not counted. Resources used by the VMware Service Console are not included in the aggregate. This value represents the amount of resources available for the root resource pool for running virtual machines.

occi:attribute.name: effectiveMemory
occi:attribute.title: Effective memory resources (in MB) available to run virtual machines. This is the aggregated effective resource level from all running hosts. Hosts that are in maintenance mode or are unresponsive are not counted. Resources used by the VMware Service Console are not included in the aggregate. This value represents the amount of resources available for the root resource pool for running virtual machines.

occi:attribute.name: numCpuCores
occi:attribute.title: Number of physical CPU cores. Physical CPU cores are the processors contained by a CPU package.

occi:attribute.name: numCpuThreads
occi:attribute.title: Aggregated number of CPU threads.

occi:attribute.name: numEffectiveHosts
occi:attribute.title: Total number of effective hosts.

occi:attribute.name: numHosts
occi:attribute.title: Total number of hosts.

occi:attribute.name: overallStatus
occi:attribute.title: Overall alarm status.

occi:attribute.name: totalCpu
occi:attribute.title: Aggregated CPU resources of all hosts, in MHz.

occi:attribute.name: totalMemory
occi:attribute.title: Aggregated memory resources of all hosts, in bytes.

occi:mixin.title: Cluster-wide configuration of the VMware HA service. (HA = high availability)

occi:attribute.name: admissionControlEnabled
occi:attribute.title:
Flag that determines whether strict admission control is enabled. When you use admission control, the following operations are prevented, if doing so would violate the admissionControlPolicy. Powering on a virtual machine in the cluster. Migrating a virtual machine into the cluster. Increasing the CPU or memory reservation of powered-on virtual machines in the cluster. With admission control disabled, there is no assurance that all virtual machines in the HA cluster can be restarted after a host failure. VMware recommends that you do not disable admission control, but you might need to do so temporarily, for the following reasons:
If you need to violate the failover constraints when there are not enough resources to support them (for example, if you are placing hosts in standby mode to test them for use with DPM). If an automated process needs to take actions that might temporarily violate the failover constraints (for example, as part of an upgrade directed by VMware Update Manager). If you need to perform testing or maintenance operations.

occi:attribute.name: HAEnabled
occi:attribute.title: Flag to indicate whether or not VMware HA is enabled.

occi:attribute.name: dasOptionKeys
occi:attribute.title: The name of the option using dot notation to reflect the option's position in a hierarchy. For example, you might have an option called "Ethernet" and another option that is a child of that called "Connection". In this case, the key for the latter could be defined as "Ethernet.Connection"

occi:attribute.name: dasOptionValues
occi:attribute.title: The value of the option. The Any data object type enables you to define any value for the option. Typically, however, the value of an option is of type String or Integer.

occi:attribute.name: hBDatastoreCandidatePolicy
occi:attribute.title: The policy on what datastores will be used by vCenter Server to choose heartbeat datastores. See ClusterDasConfigInfoHBDatastoreCandidate for all options. The default value is allFeasibleDsWithUserPreference

occi:attribute.name: heartbeatDatastoreNames
occi:attribute.title:
The list of preferred datastores to use for storage heartbeating. Each of the specified datastores should be active and mounted by more than one host. There is no limit on the number of specified datastores and no priority among them. The specified datastores will replace those previously specified and an empty list will delete all such earlier specified ones. vCenter Server chooses the heartbeat datastores for a host from the set specified by hBDatastoreCandidatePolicy. The choice is made based on datastore connectivity and storage array redundancy (in case of VMFS).
The final set of selected heartbeat datastores is reported via heartbeatDatastoreInfo.

occi:attribute.name: hostMonitoring
occi:attribute.title:
Determines whether HA restarts virtual machines after a host fails. The default value is ClusterDasConfigInfoServiceState.enabled. This property is meaningful only when ClusterDasConfigInfo.enabled is true. When hostMonitoring is enabled, HA restarts virtual machines after a host fails.
When hostMonitoring is disabled, HA does not restart virtual machines after a host fails. The status of Host Monitoring does not affect other services such as virtual machine Health Monitoring or Fault Tolerance. The rest of the cluster operations follow normal processing. No configuration information is lost and re-enabling the service is a quick operation.

occi:attribute.name: vmComponentProtecting
occi:attribute.title:
This property indicates if vSphere HA VM Component Protection service is enabled. The default value is disabled. When vmComponentProtecting is set to disabled, reaction to all types of VM component failures is disabled.
When vmComponentProtecting is set to enabled, VM Component Protection service will detect and react to component failures. The actual reaction is determined by ClusterVmComponentProtectionSettings which is referenced by both cluster level configuration (defaultVmSettings) and per-VM override dasVmConfig.

occi:attribute.name: vmMonitoring
occi:attribute.title: Level of HA Virtual Machine Health Monitoring Service. You can monitor both guest and application heartbeats, guest heartbeats only, or you can disable the service. See ClusterDasConfigInfoVmMonitoringState. The default value is vmMonitoringDisabled. The Service level specified for the cluster determines the possible monitoring settings that you can use for individual virtual machines. See ClusterVmToolsMonitoringSettings.vmMonitoring.

occi:mixin.title: Cluster-wide defaults for per-VM VMware HA settings. In the case where no settings are specified for a specific VM in ClusterDasVmConfigInfo then the values here will be used as the defaults.

occi:attribute.name: enableAPDTimeoutForHosts
occi:attribute.title:
This property indicates if APD timeout will be enabled for all the hosts in the cluster when vSphere HA is configured. The details of APD timeout are described in HostMountInfoInaccessibleReason. If vmComponentProtecting is disabled, the property will be ignored. Otherwise, for each host in the cluster, APD timeout will be enabled. Note that no change will be made for a host if it already had APD timeout enabled.
This property is meaningful only for cluster setting. It is ignored if specified at VM level. The default value is false if not specified.
Note that this property is not persisted by vSphere backend. It does not impact any cluster reconfiguration or host operation (such as adding a host to a cluster) that might happen later.

occi:attribute.name: vmReactionOnAPDCleared
occi:attribute.title: Action taken by VM Component Protection service for a powered on VM when APD condition clears after APD timeout. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are specified by VmReactionOnAPDCleared. The default value is VmReactionOnAPDCleared#none for cluster setting and VmReactionOnAPDCleared#useClusterDefault for per-VM setting.

occi:attribute.name: vmStorageProtectionForAPD
occi:attribute.title:
VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as All Paths Down (APD). APD is a condition where a storage has become inaccessible for unknown reasons. It only indicates loss of connectivity and does not indicate storage device failure or LUN removal (Permenant Device Loss or PDL). The details of APD and PDL are described in HostMountInfoInaccessibleReason. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are specified by StorageVmReaction. The default value is StorageVmReaction#disabled for cluster setting and StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault for per-VM setting.
When an APD condition happens and the host begins timing out I/Os (@link vim.host.MountInfo.InaccessibleReason#AllPathsDown_Timeout}, VM Component Protection service will react based on the specific value of this property:
StorageVmReaction#disabled, no reaction, i.e., no VM failover and no event reporting for the failures. StorageVmReaction#warning, service will issue events, alarms and/or config issues for component failures. StorageVmReaction#restartConservative, service will terminate the impacted VMs after a preconfigured time interval (vmTerminateDelayForAPDSec) if they are to be restarted. StorageVmReaction#restartAggressive, service might terminate the impacted VMs after a preconfigured time interval (vmTerminateDelayForAPDSec). In some cases, a VM is terminated even if it may not able to be restarted or lose Fault Tolerance redundancy. StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault, service will implement cluster default.

occi:attribute.name: vmStorageProtectionForPDL
occi:attribute.title:
VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as Permenant Device Loss (PDL). PDL indicates storage device failure or LUN removal. In case of PDL, the failed datastore or device is unlikely to recover. The details of PDL are described in HostMountInfoInaccessibleReason. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are StorageVmReaction#disabled, StorageVmReaction#warning, StorageVmReaction#restartAggressive and StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault. The default value is StorageVmReaction#disabled for cluster setting and StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault for per-VM setting.
When set to StorageVmReaction#restartAggressive, VM Component Protection service will immediately terminate the VMs impacted by PDL and will attempt to restart the VMs with best effort. When set to the other values, the behavior is the same as described for vmStorageProtectionForAPD.

occi:attribute.name: vmTerminateDelayForAPDSec
occi:attribute.title: The time interval after an APD timeout has been declared and before VM Component Protection service will terminate the VM. The value only applies if vmStorageProtectionForAPD is set to StorageVmReaction#restartConservative or StorageVmReaction#restartAggressive. The default value is 180 seconds if not specified. To use cluster setting for a VM override, set to -1 in per-VM setting.

occi:mixin.title: VMware HA configuration for a single virtual machine, all fields are defined as optional. In case of a reconfiguration, fields left unset are not changed

occi:attribute.name: vmStorageProtectionForPDL
occi:attribute.title:
VM storage protection setting for storage failures categorized as Permenant Device Loss (PDL). PDL indicates storage device failure or LUN removal. In case of PDL, the failed datastore or device is unlikely to recover. The details of PDL are described in HostMountInfoInaccessibleReason. This property is meaningful only when vSphere HA is turned on. Valid values are StorageVmReaction#disabled, StorageVmReaction#warning, StorageVmReaction#restartAggressive and StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault. The default value is StorageVmReaction#disabled for cluster setting and StorageVmReaction#clusterDefault for per-VM setting.
